    HTTP: Magazine

    Next Project→
    • Editorial
    • ⚐
    • Branding/Identity
    • ⚐
    • Publication
    • ⚐
    • Print

    HTTP: Magazine is a fictional quarterly publication that focuses on the intersection between the internet/technology and the arts/culture. Each issue focuses on technology's influence on a specific traditionally feminine/queer dominated field typically viewed as shallow and vapid, and explores it through thoughtful and challenging content with new and unexpected perspectives.

    HTTP: takes the traditionally masculine field of tech and explores it through a feminine and queer perspective, and the magazine aims to illustrate this through its typography, color, layout, and other graphic/visual languages. Issue 03: Spring 2016 focuses on Pop Music and serves as the editorial prototype for the brand.
